Class Environment

java.lang.Object
com.example.projectfx.ecosystem.Environment
Direct Known Subclasses:
Air, Forest, Ocean
public abstract class Environment extends Object
Represents an abstract environment that hosts species and resources. Provides methods to manage species, resources, and seasonal effects. This class is meant to be extended to implement specific rules for different types of environments.

  • Method Details

    • getSpeciesList

      public List<Species> getSpeciesList()
      Retrieves the list of species in the environment.
      Returns:
      a list of Species.

    • getResources

      public List<Resource> getResources()
      Retrieves the list of resources in the environment.
      Returns:
      a list of Resource.

    • appliquerReglesEnvironment

      public abstract void appliquerReglesEnvironment()
      Abstract method to define specific rules for the environment. This method must be implemented by subclasses.

    • mettreAJourSaison

      public void mettreAJourSaison(String newSeason)
      Updates the current season and applies corresponding seasonal effects on the resources.
      Parameters:
      newSeason - the new season to be set.

    • ajouterEspece

      public void ajouterEspece(Species species)
      Adds a species to the environment.
      Parameters:
      species - the Species to be added.

    • retirerEspece

      public void retirerEspece(Species species)
      Removes a species from the environment.
      Parameters:
      species - the Species to be removed.

    • ajouterResource

      public void ajouterResource(Resource resource)
      Adds a resource to the environment.
      Parameters:
      resource - the Resource to be added.

    • regenererRessources

      protected void regenererRessources(int amount)
      Regenerates a specified amount of resources for each resource in the environment.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount by which each resource is increased.

    • diminuerRessources

      protected void diminuerRessources(int amount)
      Decreases a specified amount of resources for each resource in the environment. Ensures resource quantities do not go below zero.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount by which each resource is decreased.
